main event: There were multiple sightings of a large flying object over the Atomic Energy Commission's plant at Aiken, S.C., described as a bright light hovering over the plant before shooting away at high speed.
interesting points: The object appeared to be 50 to 60 feet in diameter and was described as a bright light with beams and spokes coming from it.
The sighting was made by credible witnesses including a Baptist minister and other individuals in the area.
The object was observed for about 10 minutes before disappearing at a high rate of speed.
The report was accompanied by a newspaper clipping from the NEWS AND COURIER, Charleston, South Carolina, from December 5, 1950.
The document was forwarded to the Air Materiel Command in accordance with the reporting of information on unconventional aircraft.
sighted object: bright light hovering over the Atomic Energy Commission's plant
witnesses: Baptist minister, A.H. Iradell McCarthy, Evelyn McCarthy, and others
photographs: no, the report does not include photographs
